question: A retailer buys a radio for 225 Rs. His overhead expenses are 15 Rs. He sells the radio for 300 Rs. The profit per cent of the retailer is :
explanation:
Actual C.P. = 225 + 15 = 240 Rs.
Gain = 300 - 240 = 60 Rs. 
âˆ´ Gain per cent = 
$latex = \\frac{60}{240}\\times 100 = 25\\%&s=1$
Hence option [C] is the right answer
